Description:
IMMACULATE - POSITION IS EVERYTHING
This is an immaculate four year-old home in arguably the best location of White Hills. It's a compact 274m2 allotment being only metres from the Botanical Gardens, a short walk to shops, Bendigo Creek and transport. The home is kept beautifully inside and out with full landscaping and a minimal-maintenance yard including synthetic turf, paving and private fencing; quality blinds, ducted gas heating and a large reverse-cycle split-system air conditioner.
Boasting two good sized bedrooms with built-in-robes, both have easy access to the large tiled bathroom which boasts a separate bath, shower and basin. There is plenty of storage in the passage and the spacious laundry.
The back of the home is the living hub with large carpeted lounge room, separate tiled meals space and the kitchen. The kitchen has timber bench-tops, new electric oven, hot plates, dishwasher and a double-sink. There's a sliding door leading to the immaculate yard out back.
There is a single carport with auto door and sun-blinds, a lovely easy-care garden and the property is on its very own title - no body corporate! Just a lovely property in an excellent position awaiting its new owner.

Description:
PRISTINE, POLISHED FAMILY HOME
WOW!! This is an absolutely impeccable home boasting over 36 squares under roof, high-end décor, spacious living, and it is an entertainers dream with its in-ground pool, Bali Hut and manicured rear yard.
Upstairs you have four spacious bedrooms all with walk-in robes including the master retreat which boasts its very own balcony and big, bright windows; there is a fully fitted walk-in robe, en-suite with his/her basins, a semi-framed shower and separate toilet room – you need nothing more!! There is also the family bathroom and a third living area which makes a great children's retreat!!
On ground level you enter to a lovely wide hallway which boasts large porcelain tiles and offers views through to the back of the home. There's a formal carpeted lounge and open-plan living space comprising tiled meals, family and kitchen all with views to the pool and yard. The kitchen boasts new stone tops, ample pot-drawers and a 900mm stainless upright cooker; both meals and living areas have sliding doors leading to the al-fresco which is under the same roof-line. There is ducted gas heating and evaporative cooling throughout the home; good internal storage, a spacious laundry and separate powder room as well.
The adjacent pool is established and beautiful, boasting a superb water feature and a mixture of paving and Merbau decking. There is a lovely Sir Walter grassey patch in the yard, and to one corner is a magnificent Bali Hut which keeps things private and feels like a resort!!
There is minimal maintenance, a caravan space to the side of the double auto garage and nothing to do in the yard with a fully auto watering system, easy-maintenance garden and quality exposed aggregate concrete for vehicles.
It will be worth your inspection!!

Description:
Private Oasis in the Lake Precinct
Just a 3 minute stroll from the banks of Lake Weeroona, or 6 minute cycle and 7 by bus from the CBD, sits a surprisingly substantial 3 bedroom townhouse. Forget about paying for parking from the moment you move in, or offer your tenants the same incentive to be the most tempting rental on the list!
Ingenious planning has positioned this exceptional residence to capture morning sunlight in each of 3 wide front windows. Able to enclose rowdy playtime or late night movie watching behind doors, one of these is the lounge.
Equally thoughtful at the rear, where the meals area pervaded by winter sunshine is open to the kitchen. Large enough to easily encompass a lengthy dining suite, an average-sized one otherwise allows space for a home office or second sofa. Dishwasher, gas burners, electric oven, loads of cupboards and bench equips the kitchen very well for someone who truly loves to cook.
All 3 bedrooms contain built-in robes and the bathroom is situated centrally. Not only does the main bedroom own dual access to it, glass sliding doors features here, leading directly outside. Gas wall furnaces such as this one typically generate plenty of heat and ducted cooling is terrific in summer.
With minimal grounds to worry about, weekends are relatively work-free, thanks to highly appealing yet low maintenance landscaping. Private and mostly paved, the rear is reminiscent of a Mediterranean courtyard, with rendered walls and raised garden bed. A single garage also has pedestrian access to it.
So, what's not to love?
Currently tenanted until July 2019 at $350 per week.

Description:
WALK TO LAKE WEEROONA FROM THIS CHARMING VICTORIAN HOME
This character-filled Victorian home is just a one-minute walk to beautiful Lake Weeroona and also walking distance to bus stops, sporting grounds, high school, childcare, cafes and more. Positioned on a large allotment, the charming property includes many original features including timber flooring, 12-foot ceilings, decorative cornice and ceiling roses, brick fireplaces, dado railing and dado boards.
The lovely bullnose verandah with timber fretwork welcomes you to the front door, and heading inside the large central hallway leads to two bedrooms, one with a sizeable built-in robe.
At the end of the hall is a good-sized lounge. The brick fireplace is currently not in service – additional gas heating is available – but the opportunity to restore the original fireplaces is available should the new buyer be keen to. Off the lounge is a large dining area that leads into a sunny kitchen. The modern country style of the kitchen perfectly suits the home and a glass sliding door opens out to the side garden.
From the lounge there is also a small hallway leading to a family bathroom, and steps from here down to a spacious laundry and a door opening out to the rear garden.
A paved courtyard can be found both at the side and the rear of the home, providing plenty of options for outdoor living. Meandering paths and garden beds lead through the garden to the storage or work shed at the rear of the allotment. Lovely established trees provide shade in the summer and the double carport includes a double gate and secure fencing.
Additional features include:
Ducted gas heating and evaporative cooling
Modern kitchen appliances including four-burner gas cooktop, electric oven and dishwasher
2 x 6m large shed at the rear of the block
Solar panels x 10
Water tank
This pretty period property is located in a fantastic position close to all amenities and the CBD. With a spacious yard and plenty of opportunity to create something special indoors, this is a great offer for a buyer seeking a character home or for someone looking for a quality investment in a prime locale.

Description:
Fun, Fitness and Convenience from the doorstep
Classic mid-century residences remain ever-popular in this region for good reason. Built sturdy and strong, they bear intrinsic charm and frequently sought-after features.
Although fully refurbished in all areas that figure financially, thankfully architectural gems have been preserved here. Well-appreciated for their character and value, they endure as highlights beneath original terracotta roof tiles. Timber floors, 9'/2700mm ceilings lined with ornate cornices, picture rails and decorative pelmets have been retained, married harmoniously with new inclusions.
Now appointed with dishwasher and gas stove, storage and bench-space galore in timeless tones ice the cake in a modernized dine-in kitchen. The lounge has a gas heater, though ducted heating flows throughout, as does ducted cooling.
A smartly renovated bathroom and second loo off the laundry service 3 big bedrooms, 2 containing built-in robes.
Beyond the back verandah, an exquisite fairy-tale alfresco area sheltered under the profuse leafy roof of a gnarly ancient vine is a delightful focus. Also, within the family-sized backyard a massive old tree planted centre stage offers shade for kiddies and pets akin. There's a shed with roller door and concrete floor, a picturesque but robust red brick garage with room for a workbench and rainwater tank for flowerbeds too.
In actual fact a misnomer, the 'street' is a no-through road, with the bonus of parkland reserve plus shortcut to Weeroona College at the tail end. Stretching all the way between Bendigo, Axedale and Epsom, creek and rail trails just a few minutes' walk away add a lifestyle of convenience and fitness from your doorstep.

Description:
Stunning Family Home In Peaceful Locale
This stunning contemporary home offers space, style and a beautiful finish. Located an easy walk to White Hills Botanical Gardens and close to the amenities of both White Hills and Epsom, this lovely property – built by local builder, Murray Wearne – is close to schools, childcare facilities, medical practitioners and shops. Positioned in a quiet court and with native bush land just one block away, this immaculate home also enjoys peace and tranquility.
Set back off the road, a wide driveway and neat landscaped front yard, along with the modern façade provide plenty of curb appeal. The main entry, with polished concrete flooring, timber features and soft neutral tones, are an indication of the stylish design finishes that are to come. Leading off one side of the entry is a fantastic ‘kids’ wing’ with a large living area, study nook and three good-sized bedrooms one with walk in robe all opening into this central area. A powder room with separate toilet and a large, light-filled family bathroom can also be found in this section of the house. The spacious master bedroom is located at the other end of the home and is complete with a large walk-in robe and beautiful ensuite.
The main entry hall also leads to a formal living area; a separate study with built-in cabinetry; and a fantastic open plan kitchen, living and dining room. This spacious room is made to feel even more light-filled thanks to a high, raked ceiling and clerestory windows. A laundry, off the kitchen, provides plenty of storage space and access to the side yard. The kitchen includes high-end appliances, granite benchtops, soft close cabinetry and a walk-in pantry.

Description:
Art Deco Family Home (Circa 1947)!
TAWARRI is a two storey residence at White Hills which boasts a prime location overlooking Bendigo Botanic Gardens.
In 1947 the residence was designed and built by visionary Charlie Midgley for a local dentist.
Terry Clarke of Professionals said Tawarri bears more than a hint of post-war art deco styling and the sale presents a rare opportunity to own a unique example of Bendigo’s eclectic architectural history.
Tawarri has three living areas including formal lounge, separate sitting and a light-filled family room.
Kitchen updates include stone-topped work benches, Victorian ash cabinetry, free standing stainless steel range and multi-programmable Bosch dishwasher.
French-style doors are among the original features, as well as casement windows and genuine hardwood floors.
The home has formal entrance, central staircase, ensuite, bathroom, walk-in dressing room and executive-sized study (or fourth bedroom).
Most noteworthy are the upper-level bedrooms, each with a spacious balcony and views of the botanical gardens.
Terry said the home is on a garden allotment measuring more than 1000 square metres with dual access.
“There is potential for future subdivision and development, with council approval.”
The property has carporting, garage, work shed, crazy-paved patio and a 3.1-kilowatt solar system.
It is perfectly positioned near childcare, schools, transport, public pool, sport and leisure.
